metadata.dataSource: Real historical climate data from UsefulDataset - Temperature and Rainfall data for 8 Indian cities (1951-2024)
metadata.description: Disease risk predictions based on actual climate patterns, temperature ranges, and rainfall data

Malaria.description: Vector-borne disease transmitted by mosquitoes, thrives in warm, humid conditions with standing water

Dengue.description: Mosquito-borne viral infection, breeding increases during and after monsoon

Cholera.description: Water-borne disease, risk increases with flooding and contaminated water sources

Heat Stroke.description: Heat-related illness occurring during extreme temperatures and low humidity

Respiratory Diseases.description: Includes flu, pneumonia, bronchitis - more common in cooler, drier months

note: This data is processed from real historical climate records. Risk scores are calculated using scientific correlation models between climate factors (temperature, rainfall, seasonality) and disease prevalence patterns.
